sn4.11:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
sn4.11:4.2: Now at that time the Buddha was meditating in the open during the dark of night, while a gentle rain drizzled down.
sn4.11:4.3: Then Māra the Wicked, wanting to make the Buddha feel fear, terror, and goosebumps, approached him,
sn4.11:4.4: and crushed some large boulders close by him.
sn4.11:5.1: Then the Buddha, knowing that this was Māra the Wicked, addressed him in verse:
sn4.11:7.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The Buddha knows me! The Holy One knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
